snippet: The home secretary, Theresa May, said there was a “high risk” that Gary McKinnon, who has admitted hacking into the Pentagon network, would commit suicide if sent to the United States.
abstract: British authorities block longstanding demand for the extradition of Gary McKinnon,  computer hacker wanted in the United States to face charges of intruding into Pentagon computer networks.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and JOHN F. BURNS

lead_paragraph: The home secretary, Theresa May, said there was a “high risk” that Gary McKinnon, who has admitted hacking into the Pentagon network, would commit suicide if sent to the United States.

headline.seo: Britain Refuses to Extradite Hacker Sought in U.S.
headline.main: Britain Refuses to Extradite Computer Hacker Sought in U.S.
headline.print_headline:
Britain: Extradition of Hacker
To United States Is Blocked
